item.title: Fuji Electric HMI Configurator Flaws Expose Industrial Organizations to Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Fuji Electric has released patches and Japan’s JPCERT has informed organizations about the vulnerabilities. 

The post Fuji Electric HMI Configurator Flaws Expose Industrial Organizations to Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Routers Hacked for Rootkit Deployment
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat actors are exploiting CVE-2025-20352, a recent Cisco zero-day, to deploy a rootkit on older networking devices.

The post Cisco Routers Hacked for Rootkit Deployment appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Charges Cambodian Executive in Massive Crypto Scam and Seizes More Than $14 Billion in Bitcoin
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
In an indictment, federal prosecutors charged Prince Holding Group chairman Chen Zhi with wire fraud conspiracy and money laundering conspiracy.

The post US Charges Cambodian Executive in Massive Crypto Scam and Seizes More Than $14 Billion in Bitcoin appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Four-Year Prison Sentence for PowerSchool Hacker
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Matthew Lane pleaded guilty in May to extorting two companies after hacking into their networks and stealing information.

The post Four-Year Prison Sentence for PowerSchool Hacker appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
More information has come to light on the cyberattack disclosed this week by F5, including on attribution and potential risks.

The post F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SecurityWeek to Host 2025 ICS Cybersecurity Conference October 27-30 in Atlanta
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Premier industrial cybersecurity conference Offers 70+ sessions, five training courses, and and ICS Village CTF competition.

The post SecurityWeek to Host 2025 ICS Cybersecurity Conference October 27-30 in Atlanta appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: F5 Says Nation-State Hackers Stole Source Code and Vulnerability Data
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
F5 shared few details on the threat actor, but the attack profile seems to point to China.

The post F5 Says Nation-State Hackers Stole Source Code and Vulnerability Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Webinar Today: Fact vs. Fiction – The Truth About API Security
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Get practical guidance to protect APIs against the threats attackers are using right now.

The post Webinar Today: Fact vs. Fiction – The Truth About API Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Customer Service Firm 5CA Denies Responsibility for Discord Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
After being named by Discord as the third-party responsible for the breach, 5CA said none of its systems were involved.

The post Customer Service Firm 5CA Denies Responsibility for Discord Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Fixes Announced by Siemens, Schneider, Rockwell, ABB, Phoenix Contact
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Over 20 advisories have been published by industrial giants this Patch Tuesday.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Fixes Announced by Siemens, Schneider, Rockwell, ABB, Phoenix Contact appeared first on SecurityWeek.
